intro: Solms-laubachia platycarpa, commonly known as the African star tortoise plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer, followed by spherical, woody fruits. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
